[blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [Field](./blockly.field_class.md) &gt; [saveState](./blockly.field_class.savestate_1_method.md)

## Field.saveState() method

Saves this fields value as something which can be serialized to JSON. Should only be called by the serialization system.

**Signature:**

```typescript
saveState(_doFullSerialization?: boolean): any;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

\_doFullSerialization


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ If true, this signals to the field that if it normally just saves a reference to some state (eg variable fields) it should instead serialize the full state of the thing being referenced. See the [field serialization docs](https://developers.devsite.google.com/blockly/guides/create-custom-blocks/fields/customizing-fields/creating#full_serialization_and_backing_data) for more information.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

any

JSON serializable state.
